titles.title: General Aviation Revitalization Act of 1993
General Aviation Revitalization Act of 1994
A bill to amend the Federal Aviation Act of 1958 to establish time limitations on certain civil actions against aircraft manufacturers, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S11690-11691)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

calendar.text: Committee on Commerce. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Commerce. Reported to Senate by Senator Hollings without amendment. With written report No. 103-202.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 329.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
The bill was modified by Unanimous Consent.
Referred to the Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day.
Senate Committee on Judiciary discharged.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 384.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate as modified without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 91-8. Record Vote No: 61.

action.text: Received in the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Held at the desk.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

action.text: Subcommittee on Aviation Discharged.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 103-525, Part I.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: Committee on Judiciary by unanimous consent not to exceed one calendar day

action.text: Mr. Brooks asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Judiciary have until 6:00 p.m. on June 24 to file a report on S. 1458. Agreed to without objection.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 103-525, Part II. Filed late, pursuant to previous special order.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 311.

action.text: Mr. Brooks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Senate concurred in the House amendment with an amendment (SP 2440) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Brooks asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 8/2/1994--Senate agreed to House amendment with amendment. General Aviation Revitalization Act of 1994 - Sets forth a statute of limitations within which, with certain exceptions, a person must bring a civil action against an aircraft manufacturer for damages for death or injury or damage to property arising from a general aviation aircraft accident. Specifies the limitation period as 18 years with respect to general aviation aircraft and parts.
